Message: I know that I promise you to train today, but I really don't want to do it, because I think I will fail in your training exercise.

It's natural to feel apprehensive, especially when facing new challenges. Remember, I'm here to guide and support you every step of the way. Let's break it down together, and I'll celebrate even the smallest improvements with you. We grow through practice, so let's begin
I know you want, but I really don't want to do it, i am just feeling sad and unmotivated to train or to do anything kind of exercise.

I understand your feelings may be holding you back right now. Know that overcoming these moments makes us stronger mentally and physically. Let's focus on taking one positive action at a time â€“ starting with putting on your sports gear. Once ready, we'll tackle the rest together.
I don't want to train, but I feel like training could be beneficial for me, even though my motivation is very low, maybe we can train next time, but today I don't want to.

Your well-being matters most, and I respect your decision today. While we'll regroup for our planned session tomorrow, let's find a small activity to engage in now, something that brings a smile to your face while still moving your body. Even baby steps count as progress, and we'll build
